questions.question: I don't like ....................... of my science teachers.
questions.description: Either means one or the other of two people or things.

questions.question: You don't like him, do you? I don't ...........................
Peter isn't here today. Martha isn't ..........................
questions.description: After mentioning a negative idea, we can add another negative point by using not .... either.

questions.question: I like ........................... of them.
questions.description: Neither means 'not either'. The sentence 'I like neither of them' means the same as the sentence 'I don't like either of them.'

questions.question: I am ............................ a conservative nor a liberal.
He didn't remember and ........................... did I.
questions.description: Neither means not...either. After mentioning a negative idea, we can add another negative point by using not...either or neither.

questions.question: ........................... of them invited me so I didn't go.
questions.description: Neither means 'not one and not the other of two'.

questions.question: ........................... of them seemed interested in the offer.
questions.description: Neither means 'not one and not the other of two'.

questions.question: Mary didn't turn up and ......................... did Ruth.
John didn't pass the test, and Peter didn't .............................
questions.description: Not either means neither. The clause 'and Peter didn't either' means the same as 'and neither did Peter'.

questions.question: He ......................... smiled, spoke, nor looked at me.
Alice can't dance and ..............................
questions.description: The expression 'can't either' means the same as 'neither can'. Neither means 'not ... either'.
